TimelineContent.heroTitle: I'm a founder from England currently nomading around the US/UK/EU in AirBnb's. I'm interested in crypto, startups and software development. I have a background in venture capital and acting.
TimelineContent.timeline2025Description: Spent time building out [LiquidOps](/projects#liquidops) and launched the networks mainnet. Started [creating content](/projects#content-creator) online.
TimelineContent.timeline2024Description: I came up with the idea [LiquidOps](/projects#liquidops) with [Marton](https://x.com/martonlederer) this year after a rainy ambisious walk in Cambridge where I was living at the time, while [AO](https://ao.arweave.net) was in it's infancy.
TimelineContent.timeline2023Description: I became the first external Fellow at [Community Labs](https://communitylabs.com) right after their seed round. I returned my analytics grant to focus fully on the [Arweave](https://arweave.org) ecosystem. During my time here I built [Othent](/projects#othent), Oases, Subsidise-JS, and worked as an Engineering Partner on [AO Ventures](https://aoventures.io). I supported the teams in the cohort and help decide who participated in demo day from a technical perspective, I ended up also participating with my new idea - [LiquidOps](/projects#liquidops).
TimelineContent.timeline2022Title: Joined Community Labs & built my first project Wallety
TimelineContent.timeline2022Description: After realising investing didn't excite me as much as building does, I set out on a mission to learn to code from scratch. I ended up picking up learning to code quite quickly and built my first project [Wallety](/projects#wallety). It was exhausting but exhilarating. I then grabbed the attention of [Tate Berenbaum](https://x.com/TateBerenbaum) who became a close friend and I decided to join him at [Community Labs](https://communitylabs).
TimelineContent.timeline2021Title: Broke Into Crypto VC from my bedroom
TimelineContent.timeline2021Description: I landed an unpaid internship at a crypto venture capital fund from the previous years cold emailing. I worked for 3 months without pay before they offered me a paid analyst role, I then worked on their venture and hedge funds for the next year. I spent my time mainly doing due dilligence on dealflow, took notes in their weekly investment communitee meetings and also met with founders who wanted to pitch the firm. During this year I also volunteered a [Polkadot Ambassador](https://polkadot.com/community/ambassador-program) where I helped build out the community and held a IRL London picnic where over 100 people turned up including ecosystem teams and founders.
TimelineContent.timeline2020Title: Crypto Teen & dropping out of drama school
TimelineContent.timeline2020Description: While I was attending drama school at [Emil Dale Academy](https://www.emildale.co.uk), I started a Crypto TikTok educational channel aimed at educating Gen Z on Crypto. Ethereum's price was $201! Selling clothes to pay for Drama school. In a bid to break into the industry I decided to cold email over 500 companies, investment firms and projects on if they would take me on as a unpaid worker. Out of the over 500 emails about 6 hit. I used to take Zoom meetings in the car park of school with my classmates phone that had data on while I skipped classes to pitch VCs and businesses about potentially hiring me, it was a really surreal time in my life and has just kept getting more surreal since.

AngelPage.title: Angel Investing
introParagraphs: I love meeting founders who are building something they genuinely care about. When I see potential and ways I can help beyond just capital, I'm eager to get involved early.

I've been through pretty much every job in a startup—CEO, developer, product manager, engineering partner. I've sat on the other side as an investor analyst and fund associate. I've run multiple companies across jurisdictions including UK Limited Liability entities and US Delaware C Corps.

I've participated in and judged hackathons, purchased companies and IP, and once lost my entire net worth overnight to a tax mistake that put me £20k in debt. I've been a content creator, handled COO responsibilities, and can help you avoid the same mistakes I've made.

I've operated and succeeded in both bull and bear markets. Made and lost everything numerous times. Hired and fired people. Had tough conversations with investors. Managed and worked in teams. Fundraised over half a million dollars. Fought off two major black swan events as a crypto founder. I'm well-versed at devising strategies for super complicated problems.

I will fight for you in your darkest hours and won't be afraid to tell you the truth at your highest. Due to compliance, I can't advise on legal, finance, or accounting—but I can introduce you to lawyers, accountants, investors, design agencies, marketing professionals, and accelerator programs I've worked with.

I typically write checks between **$500 and $5,000** in pre-seed and really early seed rounds. Although I don't write the biggest checks, I try to be useful. Whether that's introductions, product feedback, technical advice, or just being someone to talk through problems with—I want to be the kind of investor I'd want on my cap table.
Building something interesting? I'd love to hear about it.
AngelPage.getInTouch: Pitch me in public on X

ProjectsPage.title: Projects
ProjectsPage.walletyDescription: A [Polkadot](https://polkadot.com) & [Kusama](https://kusama.network/) ecosystem analytics website, which aimed to show users useful analytics about their wallets like spending, monthly usuage, CSV exporting and money paid in network fees. I raised over $100k in grants from the [Kusama DAO](https://dune.com/substrate/kusama-gov), which were later returned as I wanted to join [Community Labs](https://www.communitylabs.com/).
ProjectsPage.othentDescription: The mission of [Othent](https://othent.io) was to enable normal everyday online consumers to access blockchain projects, without the use of complex cryptographic private keys and instead use any Oauth account access like Google. I founded the project as the 1st outside Fellow incubated within [Community Labs](https://www.communitylabs.com), a software development company founded by [Tate Berenbaum](https://x.com/TateBerenbaum) in the [Arweave](https://arweave.org) ecosystem. [Othent](https://othent.io) was then aquired by [Wander](https://wander.app) into their core product, an [Arweave](https://arweave.org) & [AO](https://ao.arweave.net) ecosystem Web3 wallet that has over 50,000 users, becoming [Wander Connect](https://www.wander.app/connect).
ProjectsPage.liquidOpsDescription: A lending and borrowing protocol built on [AO](https://ao.arweave.net), aiming to unlock over $400m worth of [Arweave](https://arweave.org) tokens value. I co-founded the project with [Marton Lederer](https://x.com/martonlederer), became the 1st Fellow led company to spin out of [Community Labs](https://www.communitylabs.com), attracted thousands of [waitlist](https://x.com/Liquid_Ops/status/1863863983498805473?s=20) signups which grew to $55m soft-commits for the idea with on-chain fund verification, [pitched](https://x.com/aoTheVentures/status/1813676139795374171?s=20) at [AO Ventures](https://www.aoventures.io) demo day and then raised a [$325k pre-seed round](https://www.ibtimes.co.uk/revolutionizing-defi-how-lorimer-jenkins-marton-lederer-are-transforming-arweave-liquidops-1729945). We launched mainnet, have numerious intergrations including the AO Chrome/IOS/Andriod wallets [Wander](https://wander.app) & [Beacon](https://getbeaconapp.com). We also have completed & passed audits by the firms such as [Spearbit](https://cantina.xyz/solutions/spearbit) & [Quantstamp](https://quantstamp.com/).
ProjectsPage.contentCreationDescription: I create short form video content across all major social media platforms that support reels. I aim for them to be a great way to build my online community, show the world what I am working on and meet new people in new places. One of the most valuable lessons I have learned up until this point is that startups are not all about product, growth and marketing are just as (if not more) important.
ProjectsPage.cryptoTeenDescription: [Crypto Teen](https://www.tiktok.com/@lorimer__jenkins) is a cryptocurrency TikTok channel aiming to educate Gen Z on what crypto is, covering basic concepts and know-how in the Web3 blockchain space.

BookshelfPage.title: Bookshelf
BookshelfPage.subtitle: Books that have helped shape my thinking
BookshelfPage.richDadPoorDadNotes: A great introduction to financial literacy and the importance of assets over liabilities.
BookshelfPage.1984Notes: A chilling and prophetic dystopian novel that remains terrifyingly relevant today.
BookshelfPage.zeroToOneAuthorBio: Co-founder of PayPal and Palantir Technologies
BookshelfPage.zeroToOneNotes: It provides a guide for entrepreneurs on how to build monopolies and create value by questioning conventional wisdom to find new opportunities, challenge competition, and build valuable companies.
BookshelfPage.hardThingNotes: Brutally honest advice on building and running a startup. No sugarcoating, just real experiences.
BookshelfPage.whatYouDoNotes: Fascinating exploration of company culture through historical examples from Toussaint Louverture to Genghis Khan.
BookshelfPage.spareNotes: A candid look into royal life and the pressures of growing up in the public eye as a royal.
BookshelfPage.riseAndFallNotes: A biography that chronicles the lives of Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson, from their marriage to the present day.
